paper_abstract: An ErdAs-Ko-Rado set in a block design is a set of pairwise intersecting blocks. In this article we study ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets in designs, Steiner systems. The Steiner triple systems and other special classes are treated separately. For , we prove that the largest ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets cannot be larger than a point-pencil if and that the largest ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets are point-pencils if also and . For unitals we also determine an upper bound on the size of the second-largest maximal ErdAs-Ko-Rado sets.
paper_title: The largest Erdos-Ko-Rado sets in 2-(v, k, 1) designs
